page.title: 05ARABLE FARMING-S.CREAKE
page.content: Farming is the principal industry of this rural area. Most of the land is tenanted. One unit of about 800 acres is owned by a large farming company which is itself a subsidiary of a national Insurance group. One small-holding of about 35 acres is in private ownership but it is becoming increasingly difficult to be self-supporting on such small acreage. This is a prime sugar-beet growing area with the processing factory 22 miles distant at Kings Lynn. The climate is conducive to the production of good malting barley. Wheat oats and oilseed rape are also grown, and some ryegrass for seed production. Carrots and potatoes provide useful break-crops. One labour intensive farm grows Brussels Sprouts and has 70 acres of apple orchards. The farmers are sympathetic about conservation.
